title: Blackadder the third. - [Vol. 1].
brief_description: The Blackadder Chronicles continue into the golden age of wealth, power and discovery but not for Edmund Blackadder Esquire. Rowan Atkinson is Blackadder, the permanently exasperated and scheming butler. Tony Robinson is Baldrick, the unimaginably stupid manservant and Hugh Laurie is His Royal Highness, a foppish fool. The three hilarious episodes are “Dish and dishonesty”: When the new Prime Minister, Pitt the Younger, threatens to bankrupt the Prince Regent, Blackadder, seeing his livelihood threatened springs into action. The fate and fortune of the Blackadder camp rest on the newly elected member for Parliament, Baldrick. “Ink and incapability”: Prince George is approached by Dr. Johnson with a view to patronising his new dictionary. Blackadder is unimpressed until Johnson’s enthusiasm for a novel by a “Gertrude Perkins” becomes clear. In the interim what has Baldrick done with the only copy of the dictionary? “Nob and nobility”: Following the French Revolution everybody in England, except Blackadder, has lost their heads over things French and the heroic Scarlet Pimpernel. However, Blackadder and the Pimpernel’s paths soon cross.
